CWEs: CWE-209: Information Exposure Through an Error Message
CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to information exposure through environment variables and error messages. It also allows Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) from any origin, which can lead to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF). The function does not sanitize user input, which can lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The function also allows the serving of dotfiles, which can expose sensitive system files.
